Opensearch documentation!¶

Here you will find documentation regarding various aspects of the Opensearch project. It is a work in progress so please let the development team know if new or better documentations is needed. Send a email to opensearch.head@gmail.com in this regard.

  • Fedora
    • Version 3.4.1
    • Version 3.4
    • Version 3.3
    • Version 3.2
  • Solr
  • Solr Regression Test
  • Datadock
  • DBC’s Python Project

Introduction to DBC’s Fedora¶

At DBC we use the Fedora Commons Repository in ways which have demanded that we patch the source code and change some of the policy settings in the configuration of the repository. For a detailed description of how what changes we have made see here: Introduction to DBC’s Fedora.

Introduction to DBC’s Solr¶

At DBC we use the Solr/Lucene... For further details pleaser refer to: Introduction to DBC’s Solr.

Introduction to Solr Regression Test¶

An easy to use test framework used for testing a post from it is ingested into FCREPO until it is made searchable through a Lucene index. For further details please refer to: Solr Regression Test

Introduction to the Datadock¶

The Datadock serves as an intermediate layer between the Fedora Commons Repository (FCREPO: http://www.fedora-commons.org/) and ingest as well as query services. It handles the bookkeeping of ingesting new post, updating previously ingested posts, and deleting outdated posts. For a detailed description see here: Datadock

Introduction to DBC’s Python Project¶

At DBC we are striving to collect all reusable Python code developed at DBC in one common project. A very short description of the use of this project in Opensearch including relevant links can be found here: Introduction to the DBC Python Project.
